_comment: Created by EFisher on 24/01/2014 16:53:02 using v2.0
title: How has the average time spent in A&E changed since 2011?
analysis_commentary: On average, the number of minutes spent in A&E by all patients has increased steadily over time by roughly eight minutes, with a high of 137 minutes in March 2013. Admitted patients spend an average of 110 minutes longer in A&E than non-admitted patients. The median time spent by non-admitted patients has stayed consistently around the 110 minutes. However, the median time spent by admitted patients has generally increased from 213 minutes to a high of 229 minutes in March 2013 - an increase of 16 minutes over 23 months.
data_source: NHS England, A&E Waiting Times and Activity
